arch:property.oc:show_val: This is a removal locus for the cobble area known as L4008, which includes the removal of the second course of stones next to the North baulk and fill above the third course. I can not count how many rocks we had somer were flagstones .35-.5m wide the rest were cobbles. The oven (L4013, L4016-L4017) appears to be at the same level as the bottom course of cobbles and he cobbles extend to the edge of the platform that devides th trench in half. We removed the second course of stones in this locus because they were mixed between courses 1 and 2 and took the fill off of the third layer of stones before we changed the bottom course of stones to L4027.
removal locus for feature in L4008
dry clumpy hard packed silt with soft areas for roots and animal holes
The soil is similar to to top soil, it is dry and clumpy and there are hard and soft areas because of mixing by animals burrows and roots.

arch:note.arch:string: Contexts excavated in trenches were recorded using the "locus system." A locus is any discrete three-dimensional entity excavated in a trench. The key to the locus system is the recognition that a locus is any one thing. Differences in soil composition or texture are therefore as important as, for example, the difference between a pit and a wall. If two entities were distinct, they were considered separate loci and were therefore assigned separate locus numbers. It should also be noted that every context excavated in a trench was given a locus number and thus the trench itself is made up completely of excavated loci.

oc:metadata.dc:title: Kenan Tepe: Area B / Trench 4 / Locus 4021 (Locus)
